name: Lost for Words! 22 Trivia Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"It's the ______ of the tiger 
It's the thrill of the fight 
Risin' up to the challenge of our rival."

So, what part of the tiger is this song about?
questions.explanation:
eye.

	"Eye Of The Tiger", a 1982 hit for the US group Survivor, featured in the film "Rocky III".Written and produced by Frankie Sullivan and Jim Peterik "Eye Of The Tiger" was a US and UK chart topper.

questions.text:
"Midnight at the oasis
Send your ______ to bed
Shadows paintin' our faces
Traces of romance in our heads."

Who's being sent to bed?
questions.explanation:
camel.

	US singer Maria Muldaur charted with these lyrics from "Midnight At The Oasis" in 1974.Maria released the gospel album "Gospel Nights" in the 1980's and continues to tour and appear in stage musicals.

questions.text:
"When times get rough 
And friends just can't be found 
Like a ______ over troubled water 
I will lay me down."

So, how are we helped over the troubled water?
questions.explanation:
bridge.

	"Bridge Over Troubled Water" was a massive hit for folksy duo Simon and Garfunkel in 1970. The single was a chart topper on both side of the Atlantic. The album of the same name was a fixture in the UK charts for nearly six years.

questions.text:
"What's the matter with the ______ I'm wearing? 
(Can't you tell that your tie's too wide?) 
Maybe I should buy some old tab collars? 
(Welcome back to the age of jive.)"

What is the cause this fashion feud?
questions.explanation:
clothes.

	These lyrics come from Billy Joel's 1980 song "It's Still Rock And Roll To Me". Singer / song writer / pianist Billy was born William Martin Joel in New York in 1949."It's Still Rock And Roll To Me" was a US chart topper, peaking at #14 in the UK.

questions.text:
"And then I saw you out the corner of my eyes
A little girl alone and so shy
I had the last _____ with you
Two lonely people together."

What was the evening's romantic finale?
questions.explanation:
waltz.

	Engelbert Humperdinck hit charts with from "The Last Waltz" in 1967.This Les Reed and Barry Mason composition was a UK chart topper, peaking at #25 in the US charts. Engelbert Humperdinck was born Arnold Dorsey in India in 1936.

questions.text:
"I really want to see you
Really want to be with you
Really want to see you _____
But it takes so long, my _____."

To whom is this George Harrison song devoted?
questions.explanation:
Lord.

	Lyrics from former Beatle George Harrison's song "My Sweet Lord". This US and UK chart topper was George's first solo success. George Harrison died in 2001.

questions.text:
"You went away and left me long time ago 
And now you're ______ on my door 
I hear you ______ 
But you can't come in."

How was the visitor trying to attract attention?
questions.explanation:
knocking.

	Dave Edmunds released "I Hear You Knocking" in 1970. This UK chart topper made #4 in the US.As a record producer Dave Edmunds has worked with Dion, Del Shannon, The Everly Brothers and Status Quo.

questions.text:
"Walk like a _____, talk like a _____ 
Walk like a _____ my son 
No woman's worth crawlin' on the earth 
So walk like a _____, my son."

How is dad advising his son to conduct himself?
questions.explanation:
man.

	These lyrics come from the classic Four Seasons single "Walk Like A Man".This 1963 US chart topper peaked at #12 in the UK. The Four Seasons was the first group to have three successive US #1 singles.

questions.text:
I feel it in my fingers 
"I feel it in my toes 
Love is all around me 
And so the feeling _____."

What happens to that special feeling?
questions.explanation:
grows.

	"Love Is All Around" was originally a hit for UK group the Troggs in 1967. The song was written by the group's frontman Reg Presley.A 1994 version of "Love Is All Around" by Wet, Wet, Wet featured in the movie "Four Weddings and a Funeral". This version was a UK #1 peaking at #45 in the US.

questions.text:
"_____ Moon, you saw me standing alone
Without a dream in my heart 
Without a love of my own."

What type of moon shone upon these unloved singers?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	US vocal group The Marcels charted with these lyrics from "Blue Moon" in 1961.This Lorenz Hart and Richard Rodgers composition topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic.
